clinical_study.brief_title: Intensive Psychomotor Rehabilitation on Cognitive Motor Abilities and Adaptive Capacity on Children With Polyhandicap
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Intensive Psychomotor Rehabilitation on Cognitive-motor Abilities and Adaptive Capacity of Children With Polyhandicap

brief_summary.textblock: Primary objective of the study is to compare and evaluate the impact of intensive care of rehabilitation of psychomotor vs. the standard care on adaptive behaviour of children with polyhandicap at 12 months after randomization.

primary_outcome.description: Vineland II Scale will be used to evaluate the evolution of adaptative behaviour.

secondary_outcome.description: Vineland II Scale will be used to evaluate the evolution of adaptative behaviour.
Brunet-Lézine Scale will be used to evaluate the evolution of development.
Scale named Echelle Douleur Enfant San Salvadour (EDESS, in French language) will be used to evaluate the pain.
Vineland Adaptativ Behavior Scales will be used to evaluate durability of acquired cognitive-motor abilities.
The Brunet-Lézine scale for the cognitive and motor assessment will be used to evaluate durability of acquired cognitive-motor abilities.
Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale will be used to evaluate the emotional distress of polyhandicapped children's parents.
Caregiver Reaction Assessment (CRA) will be used to evaluate the specific burden of polyhandicapped children's parents.
Clinical Global Impressions (CGI) Scale will be used by caregivers.
The tool as Professional Quality of Life ProQOL will be used to measure quality of life of caregivers.

arm_group.description: patients will receive intensive care of rehabilitation of psychomotor

intervention.description: Intervention included: psychomotor 5 hours/week ±30 minutes kinesitherapy 1.5 hour/week ±20 minutes during 12 months.
Intervention included: kinesitherapy 0.5 hour/week ±10 minutes psychomotor 30 min/week ±10 minutes during 12 months.
